resources.string: Everything is taking longer than it should… Please try again later
Access Location and Record Audio permissions must be granted to proceed. Please go to settings to grant app both permissions
You have to have an existing account to log in through google… go create an account
You must be a surveyor, Survey Admin or Super Admin to be able to log in to this app
No Surveys assigned Available… Please check Network and make sure you are assigned some surveys and refresh later
This file(%1$dKB) exceeds max allowed size of %2$dKB
This file(%1$dKB) exceeds max allowed size of %2$dKB, will be compressed to match constraint

We use the Crashlytics tool from Crashlytics Inc., Cambridge, Massachusetts, USA (https://crashlytics.com) to receive error reports after our Qlarr app crashes and to improve the stability of the app. The tool provides the provider with reports on crashes and bugs. In addition to the information on the crash itself, the collected and stored data also includes device-specific information that is important for assessing the crash, such as device type, operating system version, available memory, etc. This information contains neither the IP address nor personally identifiable information and none other data from the mobile device. It does not contain data about the user and is not linked. The sole purpose of the collection and storage is to record and evaluate program errors in the app to eliminate them. You can activate or deactivate the use of Crashlytics using the switch above.

In this app, we use technologies that measure the performance of the app, transmit error reports in the event of problems and thus help us to improve the app. By tapping on \"Agree and continue\" you agree to the use of these technologies and the associated processing of personal data. You can find more information in our privacy policy.

In order to monitor and continuously improve the use and usability of the app, we use the tool Google Analytics for Firebase from Google Inc., Mountainview, California, USA.\nThe collected data help us to better understand the use and thus the app improve in the right places. All IP addresses are only saved in anonymized form. Therefore, the data obtained cannot be used to personally identify users. FirebaseAnalytics uses an advertising ID. You can restrict this use in the device settings of your mobile device: Settings> Google> Ads> Reset Advertising ID.
